message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DM, cs.CC, cs.SI, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the problem of zero-error channel capacity, which is a fundamental problem in Information Theory. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also involves combinatorial aspects, such as the construction of optimal codes, which suggests that it could belong to cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics) or cs.CC (Computational Complexity). The use of linear difference equations to characterize the asymptotic performance of the coding schemes suggests that it could belong to cs.SI (Systems and Control) or cs.LG (Machine Learning).
